beliefs_base.subject: LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: LUMI (Logical Uncertainty Modeling for Intelligent Agents) is a unified agent architecture that combines fuzzy reasoning and LLM-assisted planning. It matters because classical BDI agents struggle with uncertainty and predefined plans, while LLM-based agents lack symbolic grounding. LUMI works by grounding LLM reasoning within a fuzzy-symbolic architecture to provide interpretable, robust control.
beliefs_base.object: ragionamento fuzzy e pianificazione assistita da LLM
beliefs_base.source:
robust execution control. We introduce LUMI (Logical Uncertainty Modeling for Intelligent Agents), a unified
architecture that integrates fuzzy reasoning and LLM-assisted planning.

beliefs_base.subject: LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: LUMI provides symbolic control essential for developing green-aware agents. This is important to reason about long-term impacts and trade-offs in alignment with designer objectives and constraints. It accomplishes this by grounding LLM reasoning within a fuzzy-symbolic architecture.
beliefs_base.object: controllo simbolico essenziale per agenti green-aware
beliefs_base.source:
By grounding LLM reasoning within a
fuzzy-symbolic architecture, LUMI provides symbolic control essential for developing green-aware agents, which
must reason about the long-term impacts and trade-offs of their actions, in alignment with the objectives (and
constraints) set by their designers.
enables: Ragionamento su impatti a lungo termine

beliefs_base.subject: LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: LUMI features a modular architecture enabling cognitively grounded symbolic structures, fuzzy uncertainty modeling, and natural language-based task decomposition. Modularity matters for robustness and interpretability. It works by connecting specialized agents and tools within a single decision-making pipeline.
beliefs_base.source:
Its modular architecture enables cognitively grounded symbolic structures,
fuzzy uncertainty modeling, and natural language-based task decomposition within a single decision-making
pipeline.

beliefs_base.subject: LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: The LUMI project is currently a work in progress. This matters for understanding the maturity and feature completeness of the system. It indicates that ongoing development is expanding capabilities such as the fuzzy logic engine.
beliefs_base.source: LUMI is currently a work in progress.

beliefs_base.subject: Prototipo LUMI in eLearning adattivo
beliefs_base.definition: The preliminary prototype of LUMI targets adaptive eLearning. It matters as a practical validation domain where agents assess competencies and adapt content in real time. It works by dynamically evaluating learner states, generating plans, and adjusting exercises.
beliefs_base.source:
Here, we present a preliminary prototype with a use case in the domain
of adaptive eLearning, where agents dynamically assess learner competencies, generate personalized learning
plans, and adapt content in real time.

beliefs_base.subject: LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: LUMI extends classical BDI models with fuzzy logic to model uncertainty in beliefs and preferences. This is important because it allows agents to operate under imprecision. It works by representing cognitive states with fuzzy sets and utility functions.
beliefs_base.source: LUMI extends classical BDI models with fuzzy logic to model uncertainty in beliefs and preferences,

beliefs_base.subject: Pianificazione LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: LUMI employs a two-layer planning architecture where an LLM-based layer produces milestone-based strategies. This matters for flexible high-level planning while maintaining control. It works by guiding neural planning with symbolic tools and handing off to low-level execution structures.
beliefs_base.source:
‚Ä¢Two-layer planning : anLLM-based planning layer produces milestone-based strategies and
suitable supporting agents to implement the low-level execution, guided and grounded by symbolic
tools such as fuzzy reasoning modules and classical planners; a low-level planning based on a

beliefs_base.subject: Fuzzy Behavior Trees
beliefs_base.definition: Fuzzy Behavior Trees (FBTs) are a novel notion for low-level planning and execution with continuous-valued evaluation. They matter because they allow graded success and real-time adaptation. They work by extending Behavior Trees with fuzzy semantics for node evaluation.
beliefs_base.object: esiti d'azione a valore continuo, replanning dinamico, comportamento adattivo
beliefs_base.source:
a novel notion of Fuzzy Behavior Trees (FBTs) , which support continuous-valued action outcomes,
dynamic replanning, and adaptive behavior.

beliefs_base.subject: Nodi Sequence negli FBT
beliefs_base.definition: Sequence nodes in FBTs are evaluated using a t-norm over the fuzzy satisfaction values of their children. This matters because it replaces binary success criteria with graded aggregation. It works by applying operations like product t-norm during evaluation.
beliefs_base.source: A differenza dei nodi standard di Sequence, che richiedono il successo di tutti i figli, i nodi FBT di Sequence sono valutati utilizzando una t-norma per aggregare i valori di soddisfazione fuzzy dei figli.

beliefs_base.subject: Nodi Selector negli FBT
beliefs_base.definition: Selector nodes in FBTs are evaluated using t-conorms. This is important to model flexible success when any child partially satisfies the condition. It works by aggregating fuzzy satisfaction values via t-conorm operations.
beliefs_base.source: I nodi Selector sono valutati utilizzando t-conorme.

beliefs_base.subject: Stati cognitivi fuzzy in LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: In LUMI, beliefs and desires are modeled using fuzzy sets and utility functions. This matters because it enables reasoning under uncertainty. It works by assigning graded memberships to linguistic categories and evaluating utilities.
beliefs_base.source:
‚Ä¢Fuzzy cognitive states : beliefs and desires are modeled using fuzzy sets and utility functions,
enabling reasoning under uncertainty;

beliefs_base.subject: Base di conoscenza delle credenze Œ£B
beliefs_base.definition: The beliefs knowledge base Œ£B is built and maintained by the Evaluator and contains fuzzy atoms with descriptors and optional witness sets. This structure matters for interpretability and LLM interoperability. It works by attaching natural language descriptions and contexts to each atom.
beliefs_base.source:
the system builds and maintains
through the Evaluator agent a knowledge base Œ£ùêµ={ùëé1, ..., ùëé ùëõ}, whose elements are fuzzy atoms,
each one equipped with a semantic descriptor and an optional witness set.

beliefs_base.subject: Credenze in LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: Beliefs in LUMI are expressed via fuzzy linguistic categories rather than binary values. This matters for modeling partial or imprecise information. It works by using categories such as sufficient, moderate, or strong.
beliefs_base.source:
At each state, beliefs are not used in rules in terms of binary values, but via fuzzy linguistic categories like
sufficient ,moderate , orstrong .

beliefs_base.subject: Desideri in LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: Desires are expressed as a fuzzy formula that can be viewed as a utility function to maximize until good enough. This matters for utility-driven goal satisfaction. It works by evaluating how well current beliefs satisfy goals, possibly balancing execution cost.
beliefs_base.source:
Desires are expressed as a fuzzy formula that evaluates how well the current beliefs satisfy the agent
goals, possibly balanced against execution cost. Note that this formula can be viewed as a utility function
that the agent would like to maximize, until the output fuzzy value is good enough.

beliefs_base.subject: Fuzzy Reasoner
beliefs_base.definition: The Fuzzy Reasoner currently handles simple modus-ponens‚Äìstyle rules. This matters because it defines the current inference capability. It works by applying fuzzy rules and constraints to compute truth degrees.
beliefs_base.source:
In the current prototype, the Fuzzy Reasoner module handles only simple
modus-ponens‚Äìstyle rules.

beliefs_base.subject: Motore logico fuzzy LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: A more general and expressive fuzzy logic engine is under active development. This matters for extending inference beyond simple rules. It will work by supporting richer forms of inference.
beliefs_base.object: motore fuzzy pi√π generale ed espressivo
beliefs_base.source:
However, we are actively developing a more general and expressive fuzzy
logic engine capable of supporting richer forms of inference.

beliefs_base.subject: Valutazione di regole fuzzy
beliefs_base.definition: Multiple fuzzy rules can be activated simultaneously due to overlapping membership functions. This matters for concurrent recommendations and nuanced decisions. It works by allowing different linguistic evaluations of belief atoms to co-exist and fire.
beliefs_base.source:
It is important to note that, in fuzzy logic, multiple rules can be activated simultaneously due to the
overlapping nature of fuzzy membership functions. This allows different linguistic evaluations of belief
atoms to co-exist and fire concurrently.

beliefs_base.subject: Categoria Low
beliefs_base.definition: The 'Low' linguistic category is defined as a trapezoidal membership with support [0, 0.3]. This matters as part of the fuzzy set definitions for proficiency. It works by mapping numeric values in this range to non-zero membership.
beliefs_base.source: ‚Ä¢Low: trapezoidal with support [0,0.3]

beliefs_base.subject: Categoria Medium
beliefs_base.definition: The 'Medium' linguistic category is defined as a triangular membership with peak at 0.5 and support [0.3, 0.7]. This matters for mid-level proficiency evaluation. It works via a triangular function centered at 0.5.
beliefs_base.source: ‚Ä¢Medium : triangular with peak at 0.5, support [0.3,0.7]

beliefs_base.subject: Categoria High
beliefs_base.definition: The 'High' linguistic category is defined as a trapezoidal membership with support [0.6, 1]. This matters for high proficiency assessment. It uses a trapezoidal function to provide sustained high membership.
beliefs_base.source: ‚Ä¢High : trapezoidal with support [0.6,1]

beliefs_base.subject: Valutazione di OOP nell'esempio
beliefs_base.definition: In the example state, the OOP proficiency value is 0.7, yielding memberships of high 0.4 and medium 0.6. This illustrates graded membership across categories. It is computed from the predefined membership functions.
beliefs_base.source: ùúáOOP(ùë•) = 0.7‚áíhigh(0.4),medium (0.6)

beliefs_base.subject: Valutazione di EH nell'esempio
beliefs_base.definition: In the example state, the EH proficiency value is 0.6, yielding memberships of high 0.2 and medium 0.8. This shows overlapping memberships. It follows from the defined membership functions.
beliefs_base.source: ùúáEH(ùë•) = 0.6‚áíhigh(0.2),medium (0.8)

beliefs_base.subject: Valutazione di Collections nell'esempio
beliefs_base.definition: In the example state, the Collections proficiency value is 0.5, with membership medium 1.0. This indicates full membership in the medium category. It is derived from the medium triangular function.
beliefs_base.source: ùúáCollections (ùë•) = 0.5‚áímedium (1.0)

beliefs_base.subject: Regola di raccomandazione SCM
beliefs_base.definition: A rule states that if OOP is high and EH is medium, then recommend 'Start Concurrency Module'. This matters as a concrete fuzzy control policy. It works by evaluating the antecedents via a t-norm.
beliefs_base.source: If OOP is high and EH is medium , then recommend ‚ÄúStart Concurrency Module‚Äù

beliefs_base.subject: Valutazione regola SCM nell'esempio
beliefs_base.definition: For the example values, the recommendation score for 'Start Concurrency Module' is 0.32. This matters as a demonstration of numerical evaluation with product t-norm. It is computed as 0.4 √ó 0.8.
beliefs_base.source: ùúáhigh(OOP) = 0.4, ùúámedium (EH) = 0.8‚áí Recc ùëÜùê∂ùëÄ = 0.4¬∑0.8 = 0 .32;

beliefs_base.subject: Regola di raccomandazione ACE
beliefs_base.definition: A rule states that if Collections is medium and EH is high, then recommend 'Advanced Collections Exercises'. This is a policy for targeted practice. It is evaluated via a t-norm over the antecedents.
beliefs_base.source: If Collections is medium and EH is high, then recommend ‚ÄúAdvanced Collections Exercises‚Äù ,

beliefs_base.subject: Valutazione regola ACE nell'esempio
beliefs_base.definition: For the example values, the recommendation score for 'Advanced Collections Exercises' is 0.2. This numeric outcome demonstrates the graded nature of decisions. It is computed as 1.0 √ó 0.2.
beliefs_base.source: ùúámedium (Collections ) = 1.0, ùúáhigh(EH) = 0.2‚áí Recc ùê¥ùê∂ùê∏= 1.0¬∑0.2 = 0 .2.

beliefs_base.subject: Orchestrator
beliefs_base.definition: The Orchestrator coordinates all actors and maintains the overall execution flow in LUMI. This role is critical for managing the reasoning cycle. It works by directing specialized agents and sequencing processes.
beliefs_base.source: 1 Orchestrator Coordinates all actors and maintains the overall execution flow.

beliefs_base.subject: Evaluator
beliefs_base.definition: The Evaluator initializes and updates the Belief KB, assigns fuzzy degrees to facts, and evaluates utilities. This role matters for maintaining accurate cognitive state. It works by processing input data and computing memberships and utilities.
beliefs_base.source:
2 Evaluator Initializes and updates the Belief Knowledge Base (KB); assigns fuzzy degrees to
facts; evaluates utilities.

beliefs_base.subject: Fuzzy Reasoner
beliefs_base.definition: The Fuzzy Reasoner manages fuzzy rules and constraints. This matters for enforcing policies like green-aware constraints. It works by computing truth degrees for rule antecedents and consequents.
beliefs_base.source: 3 Fuzzy Reasoner Manages fuzzy rules and constraints.

beliefs_base.subject: Oracle
beliefs_base.definition: The Oracle generates intention plans based on beliefs and desires using LLM-assisted reasoning. This matters for high-level strategic planning. It works by proposing milestone-based intentions subject to constraints.
beliefs_base.object: piani di intenzione ad alto livello
beliefs_base.source: 4 Oracle Generates intention plans based on beliefs and desires.

beliefs_base.subject: Oracle Auditor
beliefs_base.definition: The Oracle Auditor verifies proposed high-level plans for compliance with all specified constraints. This matters to ensure adherence to design policies. It works by auditing the Oracle's outputs.
beliefs_base.source: 5 Oracle Auditor Verifies the proposed high-level plans.

beliefs_base.subject: Crafter
beliefs_base.definition: The Crafter constructs FBTs for selected intentions and assigns tasks to execution nodes. This matters for translating intentions into executable structures. It works by generating trees with labeled nodes and role assignments.
beliefs_base.object: Fuzzy Behavior Trees per intenzioni selezionate
beliefs_base.source: 6 Crafter Constructs FBTs for the selected intentions, and assigns tasks to execution nodes.

beliefs_base.subject: Crafter Auditor
beliefs_base.definition: The Crafter Auditor validates FBTs for semantic and structural correctness. This matters for reliable execution. It works by checking consistency between plans and execution structures.
beliefs_base.source: 7 Crafter Auditor Validates FBTs for semantic and structural correctness.

beliefs_base.subject: Sentinels
beliefs_base.definition: Sentinels manage logical flow in FBTs and monitor execution progress. This matters for control flow and supervision. They work by directing transitions and overseeing node outcomes.
beliefs_base.source: 8 Sentinels Manage logical flow in FBTs; monitor execution progress.

beliefs_base.subject: Executors
beliefs_base.definition: Executors perform concrete actions via APIs, tools, or internal routines and return fuzzy outcomes. This matters for grounding plans in actions. They work by interfacing with external or internal services and reporting graded results.
beliefs_base.source: 9 Executors Perform concrete actions via APIs, tools, or internal routines; return fuzzy outcomes.

beliefs_base.subject: Observers
beliefs_base.definition: Observers sense the environment, evaluate fuzzy conditions, and update the belief base. This matters for closing the perception-action loop. They work by measuring conditions and writing back to Œ£B.
beliefs_base.source: 10 Observers Sense environment, evaluate fuzzy conditions, and update the belief base accordingly.

beliefs_base.subject: Orchestrator
beliefs_base.definition: In LUMI, the Orchestrator manages the reasoning cycle and coordinates specialized agents. This matters for integrated operation across modules. It works by orchestrating Evaluator, Reasoner, Oracle, Crafter, and Auditors.
beliefs_base.source:
Central to LUMI is the Orchestrator, which manages
the reasoning cycle and coordinates specialized agents: Evaluator (belief evaluation), Reasoner (fuzzy
inference), Oracle (LLM-assisted planner), Crafter (execution planner), and co-agents responsible for
validation (Auditors).

beliefs_base.subject: Ciclo LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: LUMI‚Äôs cycle proceeds from fuzzy evaluation to intention planning, FBT generation, execution, and feedback. This matters for understanding end-to-end flow. It works by passing information among components in the specified order.
beliefs_base.object: valutazione fuzzy ‚Üí pianificazione intenzioni ‚Üí generazione FBT ‚Üí esecuzione ‚Üí feedback
beliefs_base.source:
LUMI‚Äôs cycle proceeds from fuzzy evaluation
‚Üíintention planning ‚ÜíFBT generation‚Üíexecution‚Üífeedback.

beliefs_base.subject: Oracle
beliefs_base.definition: The Oracle employs LLM-assisted reasoning to generate a high-level intention plan. This is important for flexibility and open-ended planning. It works by leveraging LLM capabilities anchored by symbolic tools.
beliefs_base.source:
The Oracle agent employs LLM-assisted reasoning to generate a high-level intention plan, which is
subsequently reviewed by the Oracle Auditor to ensure compliance with all specified constraints.

beliefs_base.subject: Piano ad alto livello di LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: The high-level plan satisfies all predefined constraints and guarantees that in any final state beliefs satisfy the fuzzy formula encoding desires. This matters for goal adherence. It works by constraining plan generation and validation.
beliefs_base.object: in ogni stato finale le credenze soddisfano la formula fuzzy dei desideri
beliefs_base.source:
More precisely, the plan satisfies all predefined constraints and guarantees that, in any final state, the
agent‚Äôs beliefs satisfy the fuzzy formula encoding its desires.

beliefs_base.subject: FBT T_ij
beliefs_base.definition: For each selected intention ij, the Crafter generates a corresponding FBT T_ij supporting partial satisfaction and real-time adaptation. This matters for robust execution. It works by encoding low-level plans with fuzzy-labeled nodes.
beliefs_base.source:
Whenever an intention ùëñùëóis selected for execution, the Crafter agent generates a corresponding
Fuzzy Behavior Tree (FBT), denoted ùëáùëñùëó, which encodes a low-level plan for achieving ùëñùëó. This structure
supports reasoning under conditions of partial satisfaction and enables real-time adaptation.

beliefs_base.subject: Struttura formale FBT
beliefs_base.definition: An FBT is defined as T_ij = (N, E, Œª). This formalization matters for precise specification and validation. It works by defining nodes, edges, and a labeling function.
beliefs_base.source: Formally, the FBT is defined as ùëáùëñùëó= (ùëÅ, ùê∏, ùúÜ ), where:

beliefs_base.subject: N nell'FBT
beliefs_base.definition: In an FBT, N is a set of agents assigned to the roles of Sentinels, Executors, and Observers. This matters for role-based execution. It works by mapping agents to node responsibilities.
beliefs_base.object: agenti con ruoli di Sentinels, Executors, Observers
beliefs_base.source: ‚Ä¢ùëÅis a set of agents assigned to the roles of Sentinels ,Executors , and Observers ;

beliefs_base.subject: E nell'FBT
beliefs_base.definition: In an FBT, E defines the tree structure through a set of directed edges. This matters for control flow representation. It works by connecting nodes in a directed tree.
beliefs_base.object: struttura ad albero con archi orientati
beliefs_base.source: ‚Ä¢ùê∏defines the tree structure through a set of directed edges;

beliefs_base.subject: Œª nell'FBT
beliefs_base.definition: In an FBT, Œª is a labeling function that assigns a fuzzy formula to each node. This matters for evaluation semantics. It works by associating fuzzy conditions or computations with nodes.
beliefs_base.source: ‚Ä¢ùúÜis a labeling function that assigns a fuzzy formula to each node.

beliefs_base.subject: Basi di conoscenza con descrittori NL
beliefs_base.definition: Beliefs include a natural language descriptor useful for LLM agents. This matters for interpretability and LLM guidance. It works by storing human-readable descriptions with each atom.
beliefs_base.source:
The former is a natural
language description of the role of the atom, which is useful for LLM agents,
part_of: Base di conoscenza delle credenze Œ£B

beliefs_base.subject: Vincoli green-aware in LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: Rules in the knowledge base may include green-aware constraints defined by the user or designer. This matters for sustainable decision-making. It works by enforcing these constraints during planning and execution.
beliefs_base.source:
The rules in the knowledge base may also include constraints on how the agent should behave, in
particular it can deal with green-aware constraints defined by the user/designer.

beliefs_base.subject: Esecuzione a basso livello LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: Low-level execution is delegated to further agents designed according to current intentions, named Sentinels, Executors, and Observers. This matters for modular scalability. It works by instantiating agents that implement parts of the FBT.
beliefs_base.source:
Low-level execution is delegated to further agents specifically designed according
to the current intentions, and named Sentinels, Executors, and Observers.

beliefs_base.subject: LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: LUMI is a framework for creating and managing utility-driven agents inspired by the BDI paradigm. This matters for structured, goal-oriented behavior. It works by combining symbolic reasoning, fuzzy control, and LLM planning.
beliefs_base.object: framework per agenti utility-driven ispirato al paradigma BDI
beliefs_base.source:
LUMI is a framework for creating and managing
utility-driven agents inspired by the BDI paradigm, and it is based on

beliefs_base.subject: LUMI in eLearning Java
beliefs_base.definition: In the case study, the agent ingests unstructured documentation and desired learning goals, builds a fuzzy knowledge model, formulates personalized goals, and adapts exercises in real time. This matters as a demonstration of practical integration. It works through long-term reasoning, fuzzy execution, and neural planning.
beliefs_base.object: valutazione, piani personalizzati, adattamento esercizi in tempo reale
beliefs_base.source:
The agent ingests unstructured documentation about the subject and the desired
learning goals, and then it builds a fuzzy knowledge model, formulates personalized learning goals, and
adapts content in real time.

beliefs_base.subject: Monitoraggio moduli concettuali
beliefs_base.definition: The agent monitors understanding and performance across modules such as Variables, OOP, Exception Handling, Collections, and Concurrency. This matters for curriculum-aligned progression. It works by assessing fuzzy proficiencies per module.
beliefs_base.object: Variables, OOP, Exception Handling, Collections, Concurrency
beliefs_base.source:
‚Ä¢It monitors the student‚Äôs understanding and performance across several conceptual modules (e.g.,
Variables, OOP, Exception Handling, Collections, Concurrency).

beliefs_base.subject: Valutazione di competenza fuzzy
beliefs_base.definition: The agent uses fuzzy logic to assess the student‚Äôs proficiency, handling partial, uncertain, or imprecise information. This matters for nuanced assessment. It works with membership functions and linguistic categories.
beliefs_base.object: logica fuzzy per valutare la competenza
beliefs_base.source:
‚Ä¢It uses fuzzy logic to assess the student‚Äôs proficiency, handling partial, uncertain, or imprecise
information.

beliefs_base.subject: Adattamento del percorso di apprendimento
beliefs_base.definition: The agent adapts the learning path dynamically based on fuzzy reasoning, selecting pedagogical actions like recommending reviews, administering quizzes, or allowing progression. This matters for personalized instruction. It works by mapping fuzzy conditions to actions.
beliefs_base.source:
‚Ä¢It adapts the learning path dynamically based on fuzzy reasoning, selecting suitable pedagogical
actions such as recommending reviews, administering quizzes, or allowing progression.

beliefs_base.subject: Piattaforma LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: The platform supports natural language interaction and external application integration through the Model Context Protocol (MCP). This matters for interoperability. It works by exposing endpoints consumable by external AI clients.
beliefs_base.source:
The platform supports natural language interaction and external application integration
through the Model Context Protocol (MCP).

beliefs_base.subject: Agenti LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: Agents are executed via AutoGen and Lang-Graph, using JSON message formats. This matters for implementation practicality. It works by orchestrating agent interactions through these frameworks.
beliefs_base.source: Agents are executed via AutoGen and Lang-Graph , using JSON message formats.

beliefs_base.subject: Agenti LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: Agents are executed via Lang-Graph, using JSON message formats. This matters for graph-structured workflows. It works by defining flows between agent nodes.
beliefs_base.source: Agents are executed via AutoGen and Lang-Graph , using JSON message formats.

beliefs_base.subject: Endpoint create_fuzzy_learning_session
beliefs_base.definition: External AI clients can call the endpoint create_fuzzy_learning_session. This matters for session initialization. It works by exposing a callable interface through the platform.
beliefs_base.source:
External AI clients (e.g., Claude Desktop, Cursor) can
call endpoints like: create_fuzzy_learning_session ,generate_dynamic_agents , and

beliefs_base.subject: Endpoint generate_dynamic_agents
beliefs_base.definition: External AI clients can call the endpoint generate_dynamic_agents. This matters for dynamic agent creation. It works via the platform‚Äôs API.
beliefs_base.source:
call endpoints like: create_fuzzy_learning_session ,generate_dynamic_agents , and
execute_fbt_simulation , enabling seamless AI-assisted education.

beliefs_base.subject: Endpoint execute_fbt_simulation
beliefs_base.definition: External AI clients can call the endpoint execute_fbt_simulation. This matters for testing and simulating execution. It works by running FBTs via the platform.
beliefs_base.source:
call endpoints like: create_fuzzy_learning_session ,generate_dynamic_agents , and
execute_fbt_simulation , enabling seamless AI-assisted education.

beliefs_base.subject: Prestazione: inizializzazione sessione
beliefs_base.definition: Session initialization takes less than 5 seconds. This matters for user experience. It works by rapidly loading context and configurations.
beliefs_base.source: 1 Session initialization <5 seconds Rapid startup and context loading

beliefs_base.subject: Prestazione: aggiornamento credenze
beliefs_base.definition: Belief updates have latency under 100 ms. This matters for real-time feedback. It works by efficient state updates.
beliefs_base.source: 2 Belief update <100 ms latency Real-time feedback

beliefs_base.subject: Prestazione: tempo risposta agente
beliefs_base.definition: Per-agent processing time is 2‚Äì5 seconds. This matters for responsiveness. It works within the agent execution pipeline.
beliefs_base.source: 3 Agent response time 2‚Äì5 seconds Per-agent processing

beliefs_base.definition: Plan generation time is 2‚Äì4 minutes. This matters for complex task planning. It works during high-level planning with LLM assistance.
beliefs_base.source: 4 Plan generation Time 2‚Äì4 minutes Complex task planning

beliefs_base.definition: The platform supports multiple domains for cross-domain integration. This matters for generality. It works by abstracting agent roles and fuzzy reasoning.
beliefs_base.source: 5 Domain flexibility Multiple domains Cross-domain integration

beliefs_base.subject: Pianificazione a due strati LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: High-level planning uses LLMs guided by symbolic tools, while low-level planning uses Fuzzy Behavior Trees. This matters to combine flexibility and control. It works by anchoring LLM outputs and translating intentions to FBTs.
beliefs_base.object: LLM ad alto livello e FBT a basso livello
beliefs_base.source: LUMI risolve questo problema con un'Architettura di Pianificazione a Due Strati che sfrutta gli LLM per la strategia, mantenendoli ancorati al ragionamento simbolico e fuzzy

beliefs_base.subject: Prodotto t-norm in LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: The product t-norm T(a,b)=a¬∑b is used for rule evaluation examples. This matters as a concrete aggregation choice. It works by multiplying membership degrees.
beliefs_base.source:
Here ùëáis at-norm , like the product ùëá(ùëé, ùëè) =ùëé¬∑ùëè, or any other t-norm selected according to
the desired fuzzy behavior.

beliefs_base.subject: LUMI
beliefs_base.definition: LUMI unifies symbolic reasoning, neural planning, and fuzzy control in an interpretable and adaptive agent framework. This matters for reliable behavior in dynamic conditions. It works by layering evaluation, planning, and execution with feedback.
beliefs_base.object: ragionamento simbolico, pianificazione neurale, controllo fuzzy
beliefs_base.source:
This layered architecture enables LUMI to unify symbolic reasoning, neural planning, and fuzzy
control in an interpretable and adaptive agent framework.
